text:
91 
 
14.2 Insect Bites 
Treatment is generally supportive and includes removal of sting, cleaning the area with soap and water, 
local application of ice, topical steroids, and pain management. Antibiotics are rarely needed for insect 
bites, but they can be prescribed if the bite becomes infected.

Azithromycin 
500mg OD 
for 3-5 days 
Prevention against insect bites needs the use of effective 
insect repellents which can significantly reduce the 
likelihood of bites from mosquitoes and ticks etc. 
Removal of ticks within 24 hours of their attachment may 
also decrease the risk of tick-borne diseases 
Vectors associated with bites: Insects, Hymenoptera (bees, wasps, etc), mosquitoes, bedbugs, fleas, 
lice, beetles, caterpillars and moths etc 
Reference: 
1. Juckett G. Arthropod bites. Am Fam Physician. 2013 Dec 15;88(12):841-7. PMID: 24364549. 
Available from: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24364549/
